### Donzell Gipson

##### Assistant City Manager

Dallas City Hall

1500 Marilla St.

Dallas, Texas 75201

  

Main Phone

214-671-8132

### Donzell Gipson

##### Assistant City Manager

* [Responsibilities](https://dallascityhall.com/government/citymanager/pages/donzell-gipson.aspx#responsible)
* [Profile](https://dallascityhall.com/government/citymanager/pages/donzell-gipson.aspx#profile)

Donzell Gipson provides executive leadership for Facilities & Real Estate Management, Equipment and Fleet Management, Procurement Services, Information & Technology Services, and the Civil Service Department.

### Departmental Responsibilities

* [Building Services](https://dallascityhall.com/departments/building-services/Pages/default.aspx)

  Building Services
* [Equipment & Fleet Management](https://dallascityhall.com/departments/equipmentbuildingservices/Pages/default.aspx)

  Equipment & Fleet Management
* [Information & Technology Services](https://dallascityhall.com/departments/ciservices/Pages/default.aspx)

  Information & Technology Services

  Procurement Services

  Civil Service

### Staff

* ##### Management Analyst

  #### Karina Hernandez

    

  [Email](mailto:Karina.Hernandez@dallas.gov)

  ##### 214-671-8132
* ##### Administrative Assistant

  #### Josie Mendoza

    

  [Email](mailto:josephine.mendoza@dallas.gov)

  ##### (214) 670-3390

### Experience

​Donzell Gipson began his career with the City of Dallas in September 1997. Over the course of his twenty-six-year tenure, he has worked in the Offices of the City Auditor, Mayor and City Council, Budget and Management Services, Development Services, Dallas Fire-Rescue, Dallas Police Department and most recently served as the Director of Equipment and Fleet Management. While at the City of Dallas, Donzell helped to implement Pay by Phone for parking meters, led procurement for KPMG’s Police Efficiency Study, led implementation of the Alvarez & Marsal Fleet Efficiency Study, the National Renewable Energy Laboratory’s Fleet Electrification study. He received both his undergraduate and Public Administration graduate degree from Midwestern State University.
